abstract: The much-discussed Wyden-Ryan plan offers no new vision for containing health-care costs and relies on unproven hyptheses, an economist writes.
snippet: The much-discussed Wyden-Ryan plan offers no new vision for containing health-care costs and relies on unproven hyptheses, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Uwe E. Reinhardt is an economics professor at Princeton. He has some financial interests in the health care field.

headline.main: The Wyden-Ryan Plan: Déjà Vu All Over Again

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
